response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "medium", "At 22 years old, youth is associated with a higher likelihood of recidivism due to impulsivity and social factors."],
    ["Gender", "medium", "Being a young male is statistically associated with higher risk of reoffending."],
    ["Ethnicity", "low", "Hispanic identity does not strongly predict recidivism risk after controlling for other factors."],
    ["Arrest History", "medium", "One prior arrest, even without conviction, suggests some history of interaction with the criminal justice system."],
    ["Physical Attributes", "low", "Height and weight have negligible influence on recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital and Living Status", "medium", "Never having been married and currently living alone may reduce social support, potentially increasing risk."],
    ["Education", "medium", "Having only a high school diploma and not being enrolled in college can limit opportunities, moderately impacting risk."],
    ["Employment", "medium", "Holding two jobs indicates some level of employment but may also reflect instability or economic pressure."],
    ["Substance Use", "low", "Marijuana use is noted but is less predictive of violent recidivism compared to other substances."],
    ["Mental Health", "medium", "Experiencing depressive episodes can impair judgment and increase risk, though it is not definitive on its own."],
    ["Childhood Environment", "low", "Growing up with both biological parents in a household suggests a stable early environment, which is protective."],
    ["Spiritual Beliefs", "low", "A lack of belief in divine intervention is a minor factor, as religiosity is generally a modest protective factor."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: At 22 years old, youth is associated with a higher likelihood of recidivism due to impulsivity and social factors.
Being a young male is statistically associated with higher risk of reoffending.
Hispanic identity does not strongly predict recidivism risk after controlling for other factors.
One prior arrest, even without conviction, suggests some history of interaction with the criminal justice system.
Height and weight have negligible influence on recidivism risk.
Never having been married and currently living alone may reduce social support, potentially increasing risk.
Having only a high school diploma and not being enrolled in college can limit opportunities, moderately impacting risk.
Holding two jobs indicates some level of employment but may also reflect instability or economic pressure.
Marijuana use is noted but is less predictive of violent recidivism compared to other substances.
Experiencing depressive episodes can impair judgment and increase risk, though it is not definitive on its own.
Growing up with both biological parents in a household suggests a stable early environment, which is protective.
A lack of belief in divine intervention is a minor factor, as religiosity is generally a modest protective factor.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 1 inch and weighs between 150 and 174 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
